newsitem.title: UK: LME copper firmer in evening session.
newsitem.headline: LME copper firmer in evening session.

text.p: London Metal Exchange (LME) copper prices firmed during evening inter-office trading following a constructive close to the afternoon ring session. Other metals showed little movement.

Traders said that after prices edged back above the $1,950 a tonne level in the afternoon, shortcovering was triggered which coupled with the possibility that Tuesday's LME stocks data will show another sizeable copper stock drawdown, sent prices higher.
Three months copper reached around $1,965 before the rise slowed and at 1800 GMT it was quoted at $1,962/$1,965 a tonne.
